{"step_by_step_thinking": "Diethyl stilbesterol (DES) is a synthetic estrogen that was prescribed to pregnant women between the 1940s and 1970s. It was later discovered that DES exposure during pregnancy can have long-term effects on the offspring. The condition known as DES daughters refers to the female offspring of mothers who took DES during pregnancy. DES daughters may present with various abnormalities related to the reproductive system. The features associated with DES exposure include clear cell carcinoma, microglandular hyperplasia, malformation of the vagina and uterus, and vaginal adenosis. Therefore, all of the given options may be seen in the child after birth.", "answer_choice": "D"}
